item.title: Modbus with Energiya board
item.dc:creator: lukasmertens
item.description:
Hi,
I’m trying to read modbus from a device which also has a RS485 connector. When i try to install the energiya app there are no error’s. When i look into octave there is no energiya resource:

When i go into my Mangoh Yellow using putty and run “app status” i see the app "Energiya "

I configured my modbus in the “services” tab.

After that wen i’m going to look into my resources. There is no data from the modbus.

Where is the problem? And how can i fix it?
Thank you in advanced!

5 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Adjusting frequency range of the mangOH Yellow antenna
item.dc:creator: Carles
item.description:
The frequency range of the mangOH Yellow chip antenna can be changed an adapted to your needs quite easily by just tuning the matching network. Without changing the antenna part or having to make a custom design you will get the antenna to work on the frequencies you need. This is enable by a new generation of chip antenna components called ‘antenna boosters’. You can use Cadence AWR, Optenni or similar tools to automatically tune the matching network. See paper at MWEE here:

www.mwee.com – 20 Sep 19

Virtual Antenna™ for easy design of IoT devices with embedded antennas

Virtual Antenna™ technology enables one antenna component to cover all IoT frequency bands. This article describes the main features of Virtual Antenna™ technology and shows a simple design flow comprising only three simple steps.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Adjusting frequency range of the mangOH Yellow antenna

item.title: Maximize radio coverage using the embedded antenna in mangOH Yellow
item.dc:creator: Carles
item.description:
Hi there, fore those who are looking to maximize the radiation performance of the mangOH Yellow using the embedded chip antenna (that little red component on the edge), you might want to take a look at this:

microwavejournal.com

Optimizing Wireless Connectivity with Embedded Antennas

To ensure a fast and economic development of the new generation of IoT devices, module and chip makers have created a number of prototyping kits, developing platforms and reference designs that makes sure that any IoT engineer has everything ready to...

The paper explains how to arrange the chip antenna into your PCB design so you can boost the radio signal up to 10 dB in the low frequency range.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Maximize radio coverage using the embedded antenna in mangOH Yellow

item.title: Do you use mangOH Yellow Embedded Antenna?
item.dc:creator: thibs
item.description:
Hi mangOH Yellow users,

I’m taking the opportunity of this article talking about how optimize your connectivity with the embedded antenna provided on the mangOH Yellow board to ask you the question: Do you use mangOH Yellow builtin antenna?

Click to view the poll.

Thanks for your kind answer! Definitely feel free to leave a comment on why you do use it or don’t use it, and definitely check out the article if the subject is of interest for you!

.Thibs.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Do you use mangOH Yellow Embedded Antenna?

item.title: About the mangOH Yellow antenna
item.dc:creator: Aurora
item.description:
Hi all,

This is Aurora Andújar and I have been working with Virtual Antenna™ technology for the last 12 years. I would like to help you as much as possible with the antenna integration inside your MangOH Yellow based project. My first recommendation is starting your design with the antenna. If you start by embedding the antenna you can easily optimize the antenna performance to achieve the best possible efficiency. Selecting the right placing of the antenna on the board and also the surrounding components will help in optimizing the coverage of your IoT device.

I am here to start whenever you feel like. Please post your questions here!

4 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Yellow's Antenna Solution?
item.dc:creator: bseng
item.description:
Any more info available on the yellow’s antenna solutions(s)/implementation ??

Yellow datasheet says cellular, GPS, wifi, BT antennas all integrated. Yet the latest pictures seem
to show a single Fractus FR01-S4-224 antenna on top and 3 U.FL connectors on bottom (labeled
main, Div, GPS).

And am wondering what the efficiency of the on-board cellular antenna will be in the
low freq LTE bands (700 MHz) with the small GND plane of the yellow. (100mm length
is recommended by Fractus but yellow is only 65mm)

5 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic
